00010 /*
00011  * num_init: initialize the NUM LP
00012  */
00013 void
00014 num_init(num_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00015 {
00016         state->stats = tw_calloc(TW_LOC, "", sizeof(num_statistics), 1);
00017         state->file_size = MIN_FILE_SIZE;
00018 }
00019 
00020 /*
00021  * num_update: invokes NUM update statistics
00022  *
00023  * Each network user must add it's stats to the global level table.
00024  * Therefore, if an agent attempted to utilize the network during the day,
00025  * we must create a timer event for midnight to record the stats.  This 
00026  * function is called when that timer fires.
00027  */
00028 void
00029 num_update(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00030 {
00031         num_profile     *np;
00032         float            tput;
00033         int              today;
00034 
00035         if(!g_num_log_f)
00036                 return;
00037 
00038         today = (int) tw_now(lp) / TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS;;
00039         num_report_levels(today);
00040 
00041         np = &g_num_profiles[state->type];
00042         tput = (state->stats->s_total_time > 0) ?
00043                         state->stats->s_total_kb / state->stats->s_total_time : 0.0;
00044 
00045         // is network on?
00046         if((g_num_mod > 0) || (g_num_nreport_days > 0))
00047         {
00048                 if(state->stats->s_nfailures)
00049                 {
00050                         g_num_level[state->type][state->stats->s_nfailures]++;
00051                 } else if(state->stats->s_total_kb > 0)
00052                 {
00053                         if (tput > np->bitrate)
00054                                 g_num_level[state->type][NUM_LEVEL_0]++;
00055                         else if (tput > ((float) np->bitrate) / 2.0)
00056                                 g_num_level[state->type][NUM_LEVEL_1]++;
00057                         else
00058                                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Should not be here!");
00059                                 //g_num_level[state->type][NUM_LEVEL_2]++;
00060                 }
00061         }
00062 
00063         // reset state variables
00064         state->stats->s_total_kb = 0; 
00065         state->stats->s_total_time = 0; 
00066         state->stats->s_nfailures = 0;
00067 }
00068 
00069 /*
00070  * num_start: invokes the NUM
00071  *
00072  * Right now, called when agent is added to home location by EPI during the
00073  * hours of 0900-QUIT_TIME.  Network users begin utilizing network during 
00074  * this period.  Of course we don't want the users to be perfectly synchronized
00075  * at 0900, so we add jitter to the start time using a timer event.  Jitter is
00076  * currently determined via an exponential random distribution around ONE_MINUTE.
00077  *
00078  * We always create a timer event for midnight so we can update the global stats.
00079  */
00080 void
00081 num_start(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00082 {
00083         tw_event        *e;
00084         tw_stime         ts;
00085 
00086         rn_message      *m;
00087 
00088         int              today;
00089         int              timeofday;
00090 
00091         today = (int) tw_now(lp) / TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS;;
00092         timeofday = (int) tw_now(lp) % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS;
00093 
00094         // set file size to zero for beginning
00095         state->file_size = MIN_FILE_SIZE;
00096 
00097         // num_starts recv'd after midnight, so report previous days results
00098         // moved to update
00099         // num_report_levels(tw_now(lp) / TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS);
00100 
00101         // only send to QUIT_TIME each day (e.g., 10:00 am)
00102         if(timeofday >= QUIT_TIME)
00103                 return;
00104 
00105         // update network population here
00106         g_num_net_pop[state->type]++;
00107 
00108         // if NETWORK is off, then done
00109         if(g_num_mod == 0 && g_num_nreport_days == 0)
00110         {
00111                 if(timeofday >= NINE_OCLOCK)
00112                 {
00113                         state->stats->s_nstart++;
00114 
00115                         // update report log
00116                         g_num_level[state->type][NUM_LEVEL_0]++;
00117                 }
00118 
00119                 // create the stats update timer, and override the TTL value 
00120                 // in the rn_message data to indicate the event type
00121                 e = rn_timer_init(lp, ((today + 1) * 86400) - 1);
00122                 m = tw_event_data(e);
00123                 m->ttl = 2;
00124 
00125                 return;
00126         }
00127 
00128 #if ONE
00129         if(lp->id != DEBUG_LP)
00130                 return;
00131 #endif
00132 
00133         // if not mod day, then do not need to start anything
00134         if(g_num_mod > 1 && (today % g_num_mod)+1 != g_num_mod)
00135                 return;
00136         if(g_num_nreport_days > 0 && today != g_num_report_days[g_num_next_report_day])
00137                         return;
00138 
00139         // first file of the day
00140         state->file_size = MIN_FILE_SIZE; 
00141 
00142         // If before 9:00 AM set a timer to start at 9:00
00143         if(timeofday < NINE_OCLOCK)
00144         {
00145                 ts = tw_now(lp) + NINE_OCLOCK - timeofday 
00146                                 + tw_rand_unif(lp->rng) * ONE_MINUTE;
00147 
00148                 if((int) ts % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS >= QUIT_TIME)
00149                         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Next file request past quit time!");
00150 
00151                 rn_timer_init(lp, ts);
00152         } else if (timeofday == NINE_OCLOCK)
00153         {
00154                 // jitter time a liitle bit and start with small file
00155                 ts = tw_now(lp) + tw_rand_unif(lp->rng) * ONE_MINUTE;
00156 
00157                 if((int) ts % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS >= QUIT_TIME)
00158                         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Next file request past quit time!");
00159 
00160                 rn_timer_init(lp, ts);
00161         } else
00162         {
00163                 num_file_start(state, bf, MIN_FILE_SIZE, lp);
00164         }
00165 
00166         // create the stats update timer, and override the TTL value 
00167         // in the rn_message data to indicate the event type
00168         e = rn_timer_init(lp, ((today + 1) * 86400) - 1);
00169         m = tw_event_data(e);
00170         m->ttl = 2;
00171 }
00172 
00173 /*
00174  * num_event_handler: main event handler for NUM
00175  *
00176  * Event types:
00177  *
00178  *      UPSTREAM - event from transport layer
00179  *      TIMER    - set by NUM to start next file send
00180  *      TTL = 2  - event from EPI indicating midnight (update NUM stats)
00181  *      TTL = 1  - event from EPI indicating start of NUM for day
00182  *      ELSE     - event from EPI indicating end of NUM for day
00183  */
00184 void
00185 num_event_handler(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00186 {
00187         if(msg->type == UPSTREAM)
00188                 num_file_complete(state, bf, msg, lp);
00189         else if(msg->ttl == 2)
00190                 num_update(state, bf, msg, lp);
00191         else if(msg->type == TIMER)
00192                 num_file_start(state, bf, state->file_size, lp);
00193         else if(msg->ttl == 1)
00194                 num_start(state, bf, msg, lp);
00195         else
00196                 num_file_stop(state, bf, lp);
00197 }
00198 
00199 /*
00200  * num_rc_event_handler: REVERSE COMPUTATION event handler for NUM
00201  */
00202 void
00203 num_rc_event_handler(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00204 {
00205         tw_error(TW_LOC, "NUM Model cannot be run with more than 1 CPU!");
00206 }

00208 /*
00209  * num_final: finalize NUM
00210  */
00211 void
00212 num_final(num_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00213 {
00214         int today = (int) tw_now(lp) / TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS;;
00215 
00216         // print out final days worth of statistics
00217         if(g_num_mod != INT_MIN)
00218         {
00219                 if(g_num_mod != 0)
00220                 {
00221 
00222                         // don't mess with Texas
00223                         num_report_levels(today-(today%g_num_mod)-1+g_num_mod);
00224                         g_num_mod = INT_MIN;
00225                 } else
00226                         num_report_levels(today);
00227         }
00228 
00229         g_num_stats->s_nstop += state->stats->s_nstop;
00230         g_num_stats->s_nstart += state->stats->s_nstart;
00231         g_num_stats->s_nfiles += state->stats->s_nfiles;
00232 }
